alert.note: Alert for Russell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 10:20AM CDT until June 07 at 7:56PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Central Kansas, including the following county, Russell. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell overnight. Flooding continues along Paradise Creek near the town of Paradise. The creek remains 4 feet above flood stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Russell, Lucas, Gorham, Luray, Dorrance, Milberger, Bunker Hill, Paradise, Waldo, Russell Airport, Wilson Lake and Wilson State Park.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
